text: The Wardlaw-Steele House in Ripley, Tennessee was built in c.1842. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1980. It is a two-story Greek Revival wood frame building with a two-story portico having six Ionic columns. It has 14 rooms, with eight fireplaces linked to three large chimneys. With . The original part of the house is supported by mortise-and- tenon-connected hand hewn square beams, and is insulated with raw cotton. The interior was renovated in Victorian style in about 1887. The eight fireplaces and mantels vary in style. ==References== Category:National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1842 Category:Lauderdale County, Tennessee Category:Greek Revival architecture in Tennessee
